subject: Re: [junit] JUnit works great in IDE, how do I run it from a shell?
msgSnippet: Pat, Netbeans has all prereqs to do this. The default test target in netbeans directs the output to a window. You can find the definition in
messageBody:
Pat,

Netbeans has all prereqs to do this.

The default test target in netbeans directs the output
to a window.
You can find the definition in
./nbproject/build-impl.xml:

<target name="-init-macrodef-junit">
<macrodef name="junit"
...
<junit showoutput="true" fork="true"
...
<formatter type="brief" usefile="false"/>
</junit>
...
</macrodef>
</target>

You can override the test target so that it also
writes the testresults to disk.

1: Copy the definition from ./nbproject/build-impl.xml
to ./build.xml, or edit it

2: change formatter :
<formatter type="brief" usefile="true"/>

You will find your results as txt files in
.build/test/results.

Check the documentation for the Ant task 'JUnit' for
all formatter options:

formatter
The results of the tests can be printed in different
formats. Output will always be sent to a file, unless
you set the usefile attribute to false. The name of
the file is determined by the name of the test and can
be set by the outfile attribute of <test>.


Good luck,
Jan

--- Pat Farrell <pfarrell@...> wrote:

> I've had great luck with NB 5.0 and junit on my
> project.
> But the output goes to the 'statistics' window
> and that can't be cut and pasted using normal X
> conventions.
> (I'm running it on a Mandrivia 2006 box with JRE
> 5.0)
>
> I'd really love to be able to pipe the output of the
> statistics page so I can send the great results off
> the my pointy haired bosses.
>
> I've connected to my project's main directory, where
> the
> build.xml is (and above the nbproject directories)
>
> ant test
> and nearly anything else I can try gets a long
> message
> from ant
>
> starting out with
>
>
> BUILD FAILED
>
/home/pfarrell/aframe/sandbox/src/server/AFrameLib/nbproject/build-impl.xml:459:
> The following error occurred while executing this
> line:
>
/home/pfarrell/aframe/sandbox/src/server/AFrameLib/nbproject/build-impl.xml:140:
> Could not create task or type of type: junit.
>
> Ant could not find the task or a class this task
> relies upon.
>
> This is common and has a number of causes; the usual
> solutions are to read the manual pages then download
> and
> install needed JAR files, or fix the build file:
> - You have misspelt 'junit'.
>
>
> [snip]
>
> Any clues?
>
> thanks
> Pat
> --
> Pat Farrell
> http://www.pfarrell.com/
>
>
>
>
